definitions.definition: To mock or tease, treat lightly, toy with.
To display; to have as a notable feature.
definitions.example: Jen's sporting a new pair of shoes;  he was sporting a new wound from the combat

definitions.definition: To divert; to amuse; to make merry.
To represent by any kind of play.
To practise the diversions of the field or the turf; to be given to betting, as upon races.
To assume suddenly a new and different character from the rest of the plant or from the type of the species; said of a bud, shoot, plant, or animal.
The act of taking part in a sport.

definitions.example: He got a job in a sporting goods store.
Quite sporting of you to call that foul on yourself.

definitions.definition: Having a reasonable chance of success.
definitions.example: You think he has a sporting chance? I wouldn't call even him a long shot!
It was very sporting of her to let us off like that.

definitions.definition: (obsolete) Of or relating to unseemly male excesses, especially gambling, prostitution, or similar recreational activities.
